• 
Special attention to cord and eye care 
• 
Exclusive breast feeding 
• 
Strict procedures for hand-washing for all staff and family members, before and after 
handling babies 
• 
Avoid incubators (wherever possible encourage ‘Kangaroo Care’) 
• 
Remove IV line when no longer needed 
• 
Avoid unnecessary blood transfusions 
• 
Strict sterility for all procedures such as injections 
• 
Biomarkers (C-reactive protein, procalcitonin,) may be used adjunctively in the diagnosis 
and management of neonatal infection. 
2.  Note on antifungal prophylaxis in VLBW babies: 
• 
Fluconazole 3 or 6 mg/kg 2 times per week iv or orally in ALL neonates <1000 g in NICUs 
with high frequency of IC 
• 
Fluconazole 3 or 6 mg/kg 2 times per week iv or orally in NICUs with a lower incidence of 
IC (i.e. <2%) for neonates: (a)with birth weight <1000 g,(b)who have risk factors (i.e. 
central venous catheters, third-generation cephalosporins and carbapenems) for the 
development of IC (B-II) 
• 
*Decision for prophylaxis is on an individual basis
